name: Implementation Status Auditor
description: Tool for comparing documented project status against actual codebase implementation to identify misalignments

purpose.primary: Ensure documentation accurately reflects actual implementation progress
purpose.secondary: Prevent status reporting errors and improve handoff accuracy

required: Before major handoffs or phase transitions
When implementation vs documentation discrepancies are suspected

required.name: documentationSources
required.description: List of documentation files containing implementation status

required.name: codebaseRoot
required.description: Root directory of the codebase to audit

optional.name: auditScope
optional.description: Specific areas to focus audit on

steps.name: Parse Documentation Status
steps.description: Extract implementation status claims from documentation
actions: Read implementation plans and status documents
Extract completion percentages and status indicators
Identify specific deliverables marked as complete or in progress

steps.name: Scan Codebase Implementation
steps.description: Analyze actual codebase for evidence of implementation
actions: Check for database migrations and schema files
Verify API endpoints and function implementations
Examine frontend components and application structure
Validate configuration files and environment setup

steps.name: Compare and Identify Discrepancies
steps.description: Cross-reference documentation claims with code evidence
actions: Match documented deliverables with code implementations
Identify completed work not reflected in documentation
Flag documented completions without code evidence
Calculate actual vs documented completion percentages

steps.name: Generate Audit Report
steps.description: Produce comprehensive report of findings and recommendations

criteria: All documentation accurately reflects codebase implementation
No major discrepancies between status and evidence
Stakeholders have accurate project status information
metrics: Number of discrepancies identified and resolved
Time to complete audit and corrections

examples.context: Before moving from Phase 1 to Phase 2, verify Phase 1 completeness
examples.process: Audit all Phase 1 deliverables against actual implementations
examples.outcome: Accurate phase completion status and realistic Phase 2 planning

examples.context: Regular check during active development to prevent drift
examples.process: Quick scan of recent implementations vs documentation updates
examples.outcome: Early detection and correction of documentation lag
